The [[railway station|station]] is 5.6 kilometres from [[Flinders Street Station]], the centre of the city's [[List of Melbourne railway stations|suburban railway network]], and in [[myki]] ticketing <span style="color:goldenrod;">Zone 1</span>. ==Station overview== ===Facilities=== Hawthorn consists of a [[side platform]] and an [[island platform|island format]]; Platform 1 has a large weatherboard building, while the island platform has a smaller weatherboard building underneath a large canopy. A footbridge at the Down end of the station connects all three platforms. Hawthorn is an unstaffed station, with only limited facilities. ===History=== Hawthorn opened in 1861 with the opening of the line from Melbourne.<ref>[http://www.vicsig.net/index.php?page=infrastructure&name=Hawthorn Hawthorn - VICSIG Infrastructure]</ref> Originally Hawthorn was a terminus with a single platform, now designated as platform 1. In 1882 an additional platform was constructed after the line was extended to [[Camberwell railway station, Melbourne|Camberwell]]. In 1890 an island platform was constructed using a canopy from the original Flinders Street Station for then new, now closed, [[Kew railway line|branch line to Kew]]. The two island platforms, numbered 2 and 3, are still used, although few services stop on platform 3 except during [[rush hour|peak hour]]. A third track was added between Hawthorn and [[Burnley railway station|Burnley]] in 1972. This allowed the centre track to be used as a bi-directional track for express services during peak hour and completed triplication of the line as far as [[Box Hill railway station, Melbourne|Box Hill]]. Through the 1970s and 1980s the Victorian railway system in general, and Hawthorn station in particular, were neglected. By the end of the 1980s the station was in a sadly dilapidated state and had not been painted for many years. It has since been fully restored and is listed on the [[Victorian Heritage Register]].<ref>{{cite VHD|576|Hawthorn Railway Station complex|hr=1566|ho=42}}</ref> ===Platforms=== '''Platform 1:''' *Suburban Metro Trains services to Flinders Street. '''Platform 2:''' *Suburban Metro Trains services to Flinders Street. *Suburban Metro Trains services to [[Alamein railway station|Alamein]] (Peak only). *Suburban Metro Trains services to [[Belgrave railway station|Belgrave]]. *Suburban Metro Trains services to [[Lilydale railway station|Lilydale]]. '''Platform 3:''' *Suburban Metro Trains services to Alamein (Peak only). *Suburban Metro Trains services to Belgrave. *Suburban Metro Trains services to Lilydale. ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== {{Victorian closed stations|VICORMELB=Melbourne |Line1=[[Kew railway line|Kew branch]] |Previous1plain = '''Junction''' |Next1=Barker}} [[Category:Heritage listed buildings in Melbourne]] [[Category:Railway stations opened in 1861]] [[Category:Victorian Heritage Register]]
